Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: George_PConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel... it is one of the best places I've stayed in years (and I do get around!) Here's why: - It's brand new - It's modern and sleek without taking that motif too far - Its location is a great starting point for much of LA - The price is right, with a lot of extras included Every staff member with whom I interacted was friendly and helpful. My room was clean and had everything I needed, including an in-room safe and iPhone/iPad docking station. The room itself wasn't huge, but it was big enough for one or two. I loved the deep tub/rain shower combo. While the designers insisted on having a small pane of glass installed in the wall that separates the bathroom from the rest of it -- a design flourish that I wish would go away -- it was small enough and translucent enough to ensure bathroom privacy. The location itself, on Wilshire at Crescent Heights, is adjacent to -- but not exactly a part of -- the lovely residential neighborhoods or vibrant restaurants of Mid-Wilshire. The boulevard feels a bit barren here, but I walked it in the evening and in the early morning with no problem. Most people will want to drive to W. 3rd and its restaurants (this is LA, after all), though it is about a 10-15 min. walk. My opted for the parking package, which with my low room rate, still made for a great value. Internet was free, the pass to the LA Fitness down the street was free, the rooftop lounge was awesome... this is a really great place. Though I like to mix things up and try not to stay in the same place twice, I would make an exception with Hotel Wilshire.

Reviews.Title: “lovely weekend away”
Reviews.Author: BCK_Br
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, big tv, huge bath tub. Awesome service. Will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility”
Reviews.Author: jisabr
Reviews.Content: We live east coast, visit LA 1 or 2/yr, usually staying in Century City, but rates there were extremely high at this time, so we tried Hotel Wilshire. We tried this as we like rooftop bars for relaxing evenings. This is the best rooftop facility we have experienced-wonderful views, good food at reasonable prices. They did not rush us, but allowed us to see the sunset and enjoy the views. Room was comfortable, modern style. Bath does not have a tub, but has an oversized shower. We stayed on 3rd floor, very quiet. Valet for car very fast service. LACMA, Tar Pits and Peterson Auto museums a couple blocks away, an easy 10 minute walk. W 3rd restaurants a short cab ride or longish walk. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and quiet......”
Reviews.Author: ruth n
Reviews.Content: On a whim decided I wanted a random weeknight staycation, I love boutique hotels. Upon arriving no problems checking in, get to the room, its a decent size, albeit a little small and the king size bed really feels more like a queen. Very comfy bed, however. Dim lighting, perfect for lounging--though a light in the closet would be helpful, too. My view was of the parking lot next door but even on the 4th floor you can see the Hollywood Hills, very nice. Noticed I was missing some of the bath products (brought my own anyway), so I called front desk to get some, never arrived, just figured some hand soap would be uh sanitary and useful! I noticed they seemed a little stingy on towels, too for a room meant to be shared by two. No option for pay per view movies, but plug in play options (bring your own cables) with the large HDMI tv, so bring your laptop or iPad and you are set if you got netflix! It was very quiet on the floor through out the night, which helps to ensure a good nights rest and even being directly on Wilshire, you heard very little of cars buzzing by the street. I did room service and sadly that was just okay, the service was akward, plastic cups for beer, forgot wine glasses, no condiments provided, either, howver one of the french reds that was recommended, was a great bottle! Overall, it was a good night's rest, a nice little getaway but I think the price a little high considering you have to pay for overnight valet and I think some improvement on room service is needed and fine touches as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: Kit989
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in central La. Nice clean rooms with coffee tea machines and water. Room was average size but everything seemed new so thats good for me! Nice bathroom area with Lather products. Deco was modern and just right for boutquue hotel. Was allowed to check in early at 2 pm. This place has a roof top pool which is one o the reasons i booked here. But when i went up the pool was surrounded by people having lunch ( as the resteurant is also at top!) so not very convinient for a dip in pool! Apart that everything else was fab.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: lmb10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel Wilshire during the first week of April with my mum and 11 year old daughter. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by professional and helpful staff. We had originally booked a 2 queen room but much to our delight were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The room was ultra modern, spotless clean and had the extra bonus of water bottles and a great coffee maker with good coffee! The mini fridge was stocked well, but we didnt use the items so not sure of the cost of these. Now on to the amenities, the rooftop bar/restaurant and pool were amazing. We had lunch there on our first day, it was delicious. The pool really isnt to swim in but I guess if you wanted a dip that is what you will get! Service was great, and always with a smile and a chat. Across the road is a number of shops, ranging from cofffee. subway, a chemist, a laundry, japanese, lebanese, thai and a burger place, plus another couple of restaurants. We had dinner at the Thai place 3 times, the food was great and very reasonably priced. All restaurants were extremely busy with locals, this means they must be good! We used the public bus about 100meters from the hotel up to Hollywood, this was $1.50 each way and took about 15 min. and very convenient. The Grove is a must see, it took us about 20 min walk which we enjoyed as we walked through the local neighborhoods to get there, or you could again catch the local bus, or if you like a taxi! The Farmers Market was amazing, as was all the shops around, including Wholefoods supermarket - see it to believe it! Great food for those looking for another alternative to a restaurant. Overall a great hotel with lots close by. You arent in the main Hollywood area, but I liked that. In fact I couldnt wait to get back to my hotel surrounds. Highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay but great room”
Reviews.Author: cbsimkins
Reviews.Content: This was a solo trip and selected the area in order to be close to an art gallery with an opening I wanted to see. The general area is a bit tired and lacks many amenities that would make the area more attractive. But someone has to start renewal of an area and this certainly is a good place. Not a walking place at night but maybe during work day it will be better. Attractive restaurant on top but food a bit pricey, but nice view and singles spot on weekend nights from all appearances.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best sleeps I have had in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Al P
Reviews.Content: The perfect size hotel for a relaxing stay. Very clean, modern and priced competitively. I will definately being staying here again on my return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Judy26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in The Hotel Wilshire for a week in mid-January while visiting family who lived nearby in Los Angeles. The hotel has been recently opened and is very modern and exceptionally well appointed. I appreciated the fact that it is a LEED certified hotel. We stayed in a junior King suite and had a second floor room overlooking the street. It was a very sunny room and and had an incredible open shower beside a giant jacuzzi tub. The living room area had a 2nd flat screen TV, but needed more lighting as it was very dark at night. The rooftop bar and restaurant were great and we appreciated the heaters as it was quite chilly during our stay. The hotel is very close to both LACMA and the Zimmer Children's Museum as well as several parks. The front office manager, O'Neill, was exceptionally friendly and helpful as were all the other staff at the front desk and the staff in the restaurant. O'Neill gave us a tour of different rooms prior to actual check-in so we could choose one that suited our needs. That's great service! We will definitely stay here again when we visit LA--this hotel is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique hotel near LACMA”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLoaf
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my week-long stay for a business trip. The location is mid-Wilshire, which is an odd mix, but I loved being able to walk over to LACMA to enjoy the latest exhibition. The hotel definitely lives up to quality of Luxe hotels -- good service, clean rooms, comfy beds, nice bath products (Lather), and free wifi! Oh, and I loved the shower -- slick contemporary design and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wilshire”
Reviews.Author: lilgto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and it was beautiful. The rooms are very nice and nice sized.The Roof Lounge is amazing.It was a little pricey so don't know if we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SeaLon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a quick recent one night stay. The location is probably better for a business traveller than those on vacation, but at the end of the day it's LA and you probably have a car anyway! Fit and finish were excellent, my room had a view of a parking lot, but frankly the room itself was so nice that it really didn't matter. The bathroom is just as nicely appointed and a good size. If you do want a view, the rooftop bar has some stunning views of the Hollywood Hills and the signature "mule" cocktails were really great. From a customer service perspective, front desk staff were average at best, but the bar staff and the valets were excellent. Really the only drawback was the poor wifi. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised and would stay here again if returning for work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfortable room, amazing pool!”
Reviews.Author: vacationinargentina
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in this well designed hotel and loved it. Breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “President's Day Weekend 2012”
Reviews.Author: Whitney O
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern rooms with comfortable beds. The iPod docking station was nice and convenient. The bathroom had Lather products which I loved! The hotel bar on the roof is really cool, I would recommend going up there day or night. Amazing drinks and service on the roof aside from the incredibly rude security staff. Parking is also overpriced (26 per day), I'm not sure if that is standard for LA. Fortunately I was only there for 3 days, I can see it being an issue if my stay exceeded that.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend on Wilshire”
Reviews.Author: VacationSession
Reviews.Content: This hotel really exceeded my expectations. I booked on priceline and got a great rate for a one bedroom. The design factor was incredible all the way down to the fixtures and the glassware. The rooms are soothing earth tones. The oversize shower/shower head and bath products were a nice touch to relax after a long day exploring LA. The views from the rooftop were incredible and the breakfast at the rooftop was delicious! The hotel is centrally located (but not really in an area where you could just walk to cool stuff). But seeing as LA is so spread out it was the perfect central point. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hana H
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing experience staying at this hotel! First off let me say the location was great. I stayed in the one bedroom suite which I recommend. Spacious room and very cozy! The seperate living room was perfect too. The staff were friendly which is a big plus. The rooftop was my favorite as I enjoyed the beautiful LA views! I would definetly stay here again!! oh and also forgot to mention the shower, love love love.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: I struggled with this review. There are things I loved about this property, but there are quite a few things that annoyed me. So I'll list the pro's and the cons that I noted so that people can decide for themselves. The overall hotel is very nice and staff are friendly, its the "peripheral" things that got to me. Pros: - The rooms and bathrooms are VERY nice. This hotel is obviously very new. - Bed was very comfortable - There is a safe and small fridge (very practical) in the room - The parking attendants would always get my car fast as lightening - If you are in the area for business ; the location is very convenient Cons: - Come 6:30-7pm till 11pm Internet is slow and unusable. More bandwidth is needed - There is no gym. (However, they give you a pass for a gym +-8 minutes walk away) - I went for breakfast (apparently it was included with my room) early twice and there was no one there! I ended up going to the McDonald's next door. Overall, this property is nice and can be very good if they can sort out some kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Lily N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small, hard to find and not in a good location. It can work for business travel, but definitly not for vacation or families. The restaurant and bar in the roof has a great view and young people, but the food almost sent my son to the hospital... Asked for a breakfast at the room that never came, but was imediatly charged. It's not a hotel for vacation or families, maybe a good one for couples or single people. I have to recognize it's new and modern, with good amenities and wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place with helpful/friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Heather K
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days over Christmas 2011 in the Junior Suite w/ King Bed. Bed was very comfortable as was the entire room and its set up. The decor is fresh, w/ clean lines. We traveled w/ my 6 year old and he too was quite comfortable sleeping on the couch. Media centers quite convenient in living room and bedroom (was able to plug in multiple laptops, cell phones, ipad simultaneously, etc) View out to the Hollywood sign was very pretty. Rooftop pool/lounge was very welcoming and the fact the pool was only 3.5 feet deep = my son could swim alone while we watched from a comfortable, kinda swanky table just a couple of feet away enjoying refreshments. Is walking distance from the the LaBrea tar pits as well as several restaurants, Starbucks and a wonderful cafe kiddie corner for breakfast. Staff friendly, courteous and helpful. Do check your bill though - we were charged for 5 days of parking - we had no car - but once the mistake was pointed out, very quickly rectified by the staff. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: RobertULondon
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how mundane and ordinary it was. I thought I was paying for a fun, hi- energy, large, modern, cool hotel, (price-wise I was) but when I got there the hotel was small, dark and quiet. I cut my toe on the shower, a badly rendered edge to a tile, and no apology or sympathy was offered. Lucky I'm a non litigious Brit. Bed was good. Neighbourhood dull. Reception staff bordering on rude. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a mid-Wilshire Boutique Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: MVP_10
Reviews.Content: I had business in Beverly Hills and Century City and didn't need a big, swanky, expensive hotel. Hotel Wilshire was perfectly located close to my appointments at a fraction of the cost. The big surprise was the high design, poolside roof top restaurant and cozy breakfast area. One day we used the Board room for meetings. It is high tech and we were able to Skpe in colleagues on the wide screen. The surrounding neighborhood is quiet with several small restaurants. The front desk staff is great and able to make and deliver to my room copies of docs on the hotel's fast internet connection and never charged. The suite was cheerful, and very functional with a super comfy bed and even from my 3rd floor location great views of the Hollywood Hills. It came with a mini bar I did not use, and had a wonderful coffee maker and sustainably grown coffee - delicous. You could tell a lot of thought went into the design and construction and we'll use the hotel again on our next trip to West LA.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: party hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee59
Reviews.Content: This new hotel has some very nice rooms which are well-appointed with modern fixtures. Unfortunately, it also attempts to be a club for 20-somethings, and does not enforce reasonable behavior on the part of its partying guests. So, although it has excellent bones, I cannot recommend it for anyone wanting a guarantee of a good night's sleep. Probably, the problem begins with the (unfortunately all too common) attempt to have both a trendy hangout and a hotel in one property. The hotel has a rooftop deck with a bar and a small swimming pool. This doubles as a club at night. Sadly, the club-goers need to take the elevator to the top floor of the hotel (which has sleeping rooms on it), and then go down a short hall to another elevator to the roof. Why would you do this to your hotel guests? We had a room which was somewhat like a small suite, with nice new fixtures and a cool bath. We did notice with surprise that the carpet was already stained. However, given the discussion below, one can understand why that might be the case. While we were there, there was a multi-night, multi-guestroom party on our floor. The last night we were there, this went on until daylight. The party goers went from room to room, with accompanying door slamming etc. Not only did we complain, but other guests did as well. At one point, we overheard a night clerk telling someone that that was their final warning. As this had no effect, I can only guess that it meant the hotel wouldn't bother them again! We got no sleep that night. The next morning, we complained about the problem. The manager told us how bad he felt about the problem - apparently the night manager had left a message about it. However, what he offered in compensation for completely ruining our visit was laughable. We did take brunch one morning on the rooftop. The staff were hopelessly slow and inept. There is an excellent cafe for breakfast in the strip-mall on the SE corner of Crescent Heights and Wilshire.

Reviews.Title: “great staff restful room”
Reviews.Author: Tamishia g
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The view and food on the roof was supberb and the rooms were calming and restful after a busy day of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy, Pretty Hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenage daughter and I stayed at the new Hotel Wilshire over Christmas, 2011. We basically liked the place, but my wife was very disappointed at the short, shallow pool. She needs to swim several times a week for health reasons, and felt that the picture of the pool on the website had been misleading (as they so often are). It's more of a recreational pool for people at the rooftop bar (nice view, pricy drinks, didn't try the restaurant with the celebrity chef). Otherwise, the place was pretty good. We had a minisuite with a sofabed, for which we paid well north of $200, listed as a discount rate--it was sort of a special occasion trip for us. But the main bed was big and very comfortable, even the sofabed wasn't bed--though it left a very tight passage in the room when it was open. The "rain" shower was excellent, and the bathroom area was helpfully divided up into shower stall, toilet room, and a sink/dressing area--though the shower and toilet didn't have opaque doors (there's a sliding door between the whole bathroom and the rest of the room). There were two giant TVs with plugs for video devices. A refrigerator but no microwave, and no radios or clocks! We had to light up our cell phones to check the time in the middle of the night. Parking was $26, plus 10% parking tax. Ironically, we had to park there because we'd driven down but were trying to do as much of the visit car-free as possible--we did that for most of it. If we'd been using the car constantly we could have parked in a two hour parking spot on a neighboring street--not on Wilshire Boulevard. Transit service is good there, with frequent buses along Wilshire Boulevard out to Beverly Hills and Santa Monica and in to Koreatown and Downtown, and good service on Fairfax Ave. (one long block away) as well. The hotel is across the street from a minimall with numerous restaurants--including pretty good Caffe Latte--but because we arrived at Christmastime they weren't open much. The Farmers Market (and Grove Shopping Center) is a bit under a mile walk, certainly possible if you're a reasonably good walker.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the rooms where cozy. The pool area is very cool and the view, spectacular. It's nothing luxurious, but a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL WILSHIRE GREAT FIND”
Reviews.Author: nyfoodie49
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wilshire is a new cool hotel. Rooftop restaurant and pool. Great prices. Rooms are tight but have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Waaaaay overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Colley C
Reviews.Content: If this is the 14th best hotel in L.A. something is seriously wrong. The design team has gone too far in the chic department to the detriment of comfort. Sofas in the suites are concrete like (but they look good!), the doors all have slam shut devices on them that unfortunately create shuddering booms heard throughout the entire floor, and God forbid you get a room facing Wilshire! Ask to be moved immediately, unless you don't care about sleeping. Unlike other reviews I read, we found the staff to be friendly and attentive. The parking lot guys couldn't have tried harder and the front desk staff was great. But they couldn't overcome the design flaws or the just awful tv lineup.....about 10 local channels and no movies, espn, etc. Please tell me this has changed!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous facility, OK food, OK service”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: If your travelleing for business this hotel provides good value in a great location. The facility is very attractive, the rooftop bar and dining area is wonderful - the food not so much. The service was lacking, and the restaurant/bar manager was useless - he just loomed around and never engaged anyone in a welcoming manner. Facility 10/10, Service 6/10, Food 5/10.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel, awesome staff (especially Nico)!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erika O
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot, and I have to say my experience @ Hotel Wilshire has been AWESOME!. Nico, one of the amazing people at the front desk not only helped me not get ripped off by the cab driver from LAX (he gave me real time directions over the phone to the hotel), upon arrival, he wanted to make sure I didn't get charged too much money by the cabbie, and gave me a fantastic room on the top floor! (You rock Nico!) On top of this fantastic initial customer experience, I walk into a beautiful and well designed room. Modern furniture. Inviting decor. No hassles. Low noise. To be honest, I typically do not like L.A. AT ALL (I prefer the East Coast) , but the experience has changed my mind quite a bit. A great place to consider when on business travel near Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melinda R
Reviews.Content: I like this centrally located hotel. It is well designed, has sleek custom furniture and decor and rooms are quiet. Everything is designed for comfort and function - the bathroom and shower are roomy and stellar compared as an example to the Fairmont, of which I am a club member. Floors, carpets, mirrors, and shower window are well done. The in-room one cup Cuisinart coffee maker, is fast, quiet, efficient and stemmed wine glasses are provided. We ate twice at The Roof, loved the food and the view. New, clean, modern, plus great Vibe of The Roof with pool and fire pit - great value and simple luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in LA”
Reviews.Author: Lakeshore18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in the end of October. Location wasn't the best for tourists, but the price was great for a beautifully decorated room with very comfy beds and linens. We were on the 6th floor but didn't experience any of the noise problems other reviewers complained about. Never tried the restaurant but the rooftop bar did look cool. Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful as was the valet staff. Front desk arranged a sightseeing tour for us which we enjoyed very much. We were able to walk to the Museum of Modern Art and LaBrea Tar Pits from here and it was a short drive to the Farmers Market. Nice stay in a beautiful hotel. Nico at the front desk was very helpful. For those looking for a quick breakfast, there is a McDonalds about 2 blocks away and a small coffee shop across the street in a strip mall that was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spartyhomer
Reviews.Content: Very contemporary, pretty new hotel near Beverly Hills. Nice rooms, good beds, and awesome views of the city. Pretty rooftop bar and pool. My only complaint is the cable tv. It was sorely deficient, with no ESPN, or PPV movies.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work!”
Reviews.Author: Colley C
Reviews.Content: Stayed there about a month after it opened. The owners obviously spent a lot of money on this place but most of it went to artsy decor and not enough into practicality. All the doors have slamming mechanisms on them....OMG ! So inebriated guests come in at 2,3 a.m. go to their rooms and 'boom' the door slams shut. Even doors 4 or 5 rooms away slammed shut so loud they woke us up. Our original room had deficient air conditioning, so they upgraded us to a Suite. Our 'view' was that of the ratty roof of the old building next door, the sofa was laughably hard and the toilet paper was straight out of the dollar store up the street! The place has potential and the staff were all terrific, but they really need to change some things to make it worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Hotel Wilshire”
Reviews.Author: DBK19114
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wilshire was a great spot for us. The front desk was friendly and helpful. The room was bright, well decorated and clean. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful, clean and spacious. I can't begin to say enough about the staff. The valet service was excellent, and the housekkeeping was efficient. The Hotel Wilshire is a bargain in the area. It is a standout hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a view”
Reviews.Author: Hampog
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, modern and chic. We have a view of the Hollywood hills! Close to everything. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, beware 6th floor!”
Reviews.Author: ElNorEast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Wilshire for one night in mid-September, not long after they opened, in a junior suite. The room itself was gorgeous and aside from some issues between our iPads and the WiFi, everything was great. The bed was very comfy, the television was good, the toiletries were nice and the bath was OUTSTANDING - we had a junior suite and the bathroom was incredible. We found the room to be very clean and well appointed. The one thing that was missing was a guest book with a list of amenities and room service menus - we searched everywhere and couldn't find one, but really needed one and it was sorely missed. Hopefully by now this has been rectified. Unfortunately we were on the 6th floor right next to elevator; this hotel used to be an office building so they've had to make some concessions to the original architecture, and one of those concessions is that guests who wish to visit the very nice and trendy rooftop bar have to get off the elevator on the 6th floor and then transfer to another elevator to up (and vice versa). Tipsy young folks who are having a great time do not keep their voices and giggles down while waiting for for elevators next to hotel rooms at 1am, even when the folks inside are trying to sleep, and the doors at the Hotel Wilshire are not well insulated. It was Friday night, and we had been to a concert and had a great time but we still wanted to sleep after a long week... we couldn't, though, and it ruined our night. This 6th-floor problem is one the hotel needs to address if they don't want to deal with angry guests every night. The restaurant was hit-or-miss, but it was early days so I will give them some time to work out the kinks... my British husband was miffed that they didn't know how to make tea properly, but his detailed notes for the staff hopefully were taken in and they're doing it a bit better by now. All in all a decent stay, a few hiccups but the manager O'Neill gave us his card and asked us to inform him next time we were coming to stay so he could make sure we had a better stay, ie we weren't placed on the 6th floor!! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kamar m
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at The Hotel Wilshire! I can't say enough about how chic and impressive the decor is. The rooms are spacious, extremely clean (it's brand new) and the beds are so comfortable! The rooftop bar was amazing and had a great view of the city. The rooftop drink menu is out of this world! I would highly recommend the Bourbon Smash!!! The service was impeccable - the staff was friendly and accommodating. I will def plan on staying here again! I love everything about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff with Central Location”
Reviews.Author: W V
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Hotel Wilshire on a Satruday afternoon and were greeted by a very friendly front desk person. I think the whole process took about 2 minutes. Our room was clean and comfortable with thoughtful touches like a technology outlet in the wall that could charge my iPad and allow me to connect an HDMI cable so that I could watch a movie on the flat screen TV. We had coffee at the roof top pool and restaurant and enjoyed the spectacular view. I stay in a lot of hotels and really like the friendly people who work here. Its little things like saying "hello" when you pass a staff member in the hall, or looking you in the eyes when they speak with you. There was no pretention or arrogance - just nice people. I look forward to staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, fashionably boutique, upstart issues ....”
Reviews.Author: contheroad
Reviews.Content: We had other reservations at the new Marriott but switched to spend 4 nights at the new Hotel Wilshire because of the enthusiastic new reviews on TripAdvisor. We are not "boutique" hotel fans and have great preference for the new updated classic hotels but we wanted to be adventurous.... My husband and I just spent 8 nights in a big 1100 square foot suite with 2 bathrooms and a den at the Trump International Waikiki so we knew this Hotel Wilshire was not going to be close in amenities - but still it was quite a let down. First, all the employees look very unhappy. One housekeeper did smile when I greeted her on two occasions but then we leave a tip (to scale as recommended by the press) every single morning including on check out morning. The front desk is not friendly even when I am. We had a junior suite. It is decorated nicely (modern) but we found the infrastructure design really flawed. The ultra sleek bathroom has a rain shower (nice) with no shower curtain so the water splashes everywhere especially on their nice new bamboo wood floor. There's a soaking tub but the shower head that is installed does not remain directed at your body so it's not an option for a shower. The beautiful Roman shade in the bathroom has to stay all the way down because the large window is in full view of the office building and garage across the street. The living room area has an interesting look but the new upscale lighting is very dark even with all the lights on everywhere. The intro rates are reasonable but I would not stay here again because we did not feel at all welcome. When we checked out of the Trump Hotel everyone including the valet thanked us for staying with them. The Wilshire is a grumpy place. One big positive was the valet parking onsite - those guys were pleasant all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany r
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the most enjoyable vacation I have have ever been on and I would owe a huge amount of that to the Hotel Wilshire and its team. The place was clean, super enjoyable, relaxing, and beautiful, very nice designed. The staff was very friendly and had excellent service. I only got back a week ago and I want to go back there so badly! From check in to check out service was extraordinary!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru1973
Reviews.Content: We were excited about a new hotel in LA since we frequent the area; however, this hotel was a HUGE disappointment. It is lacking standard quality control and the service is not indicative of a 4* hotel. I know this review contradicts those already posted so we took photos to support it. I excluded the dirty tub photo and the one evidencing the blood on the wall in the bathroom as I felt it was too repulsive to post (that is a first!). Upon check-in, the hotel appears nice. Simpson was quick to accommodate a room change when the first hotel room offered a dirty bathtub, a desk lined with dust, strings of long, dark hair left on the leather chair from the last guest and a closet that had not been vacuumed. Guests venture before you at hotels - but a GOOD hotel does not make you feel like someone just left... ** We were "downgraded" from the king bed that we paid for - which my 6'2" husband was not impressed by ** When we brought these issues to the attention of the hotel Manager, he assured us he would take care of things when we left off-site for our dinner reservations. We returned late to find the blood washed from the wall, however, the remaining photos were taken after we had time to fully settle in and we NEVER saw the Manager again - NOT reflective of exemplary 4* service. I can recommend the rooftop patio/bar only if you are in your early 20's; you can expect the same lack of service/cleanliness there, too. For a new hotel, a better first impression is crucial. We will not recommend nor be back. ** Book another hotel if ROOM COMFORT, CLEANLINESS and CUSTOMER SERVICE are important to you **

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel Wilshire for 3 nights in a beautiful suite. From the friendly staff at check-in to the great decor my stay was excellent. The bed was very comfortable and the the bedding and pillows were great. The roof top view was amazing and the food was too! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sandino N
Reviews.Content: My wife & I booked a room last minute and got a steal of a deal for the area: everything else was either a motel, or double the nightly rate. The amenities are plush, the rooms cozy and modern, and the staff extremely helpful. We liked the swanky bathroom shower, and the King bed was very power nap-worthy. The rooftop lounge/pool/bar looks like a great summer hangout. Additionally, I left some personal belongings there and they FedEx-ed it to my home address. One caveat: the hotel is brand new, so there is some construction noise, and our fridge didn't work. Other than that, I can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Waverly476
Reviews.Content: The roof deck was the best - good views, good cocktails, good food, good music - with sofa cabanas, lounge chairs, cocktail and dinner tables, heat lamps and gas fire at night. Rooms were well designed, clean, modern. Staff very friendly. Location is convenient to major sights and locations, shopping, restaurants, etc. in a business/downtown area (rent a car for ease). I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dare I let the secret of the bag?”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveler1955
Reviews.Content: Hate sharing this, but I'm just a nice guy. This brand new hotel (as of early Sept 2011) just might be my new favorite hotel in LA. For one reason, I always travel with my own pillow because even the pillows at the Four Seasons I find too hard or too soft. These pillows are exactly like the ones I have at home, so no more stuffing a pillow in my suitcase! As others have said, the service and design are spot on, and the room rates (at least for now) are very reasonable, but that might change once they get going. Rooms are modern, windows open the location is just fine (near museums), love the rooftop restaurant/pool. It's a small mid range (not quite "luxury") boutique hotel with everything you need for a comfortable stay, without the hoopla of some other "in" hotels in LA with noisy lobbies and pool areas. I just hope they keep the rates as reasonable at the one I found. There's no fitness room however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Wilshire for a couple of Nights for our Anniversary Party.The Hotel is Brand New & totally can get 5*.And I thought it was a good value for the money. Our room was large & beautiful with nice bath products.The Roof Top had a pool and an amazing view! The stuff was very friendly and helpful. The Hotel was in a good, safe area in reasonable walking distances to attractions and other parts of the city. The internet was free & had a good, strong connection. Stayed Sept 2011, traveled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels that I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel is beautiful. My suite was spacious and so well designed that I took photo's too include some of the design features in my new home. The roof top restaurant and pool and city evening views were spectacular! The room rate was very reasonably priced. Service was friendly, cheerful and helpful. The manager, Mr. Rizzi, was friendly and a professional host. On my next visit to LA, I will be staying at the Hotel Wilshire.

HotelInfo.Name: The Hotel Wilshire
HotelInfo.Address: 6317 Wilshire Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90048
